content: on hand i use 10mm plastic safety eyes but you can substitute any eyes you have on hand that won t slip through the stitches or use black yarn to embroider eyes instead which would make the plush safer for all ages work in a spiral or slip_stitch to join at the end of each round based on your preference body round 1 create a magic_ring and work 12 single_crochet into the ring 12 round 2 2sc in first st single_crochet in next st *2sc in next st single_crochet in next st* repeat * * around 18 pattern continued round 3 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 2 sts *2sc in next st single_crochet in next 2 sts* repeat * * around 24 round 4 2sc in first st single_crochet in next 3 sts *2sc in next st single_crochet in next 3 sts* repeat * * around 30 rounds 5 - 10 single_crochet in each st around 30 round 11 *decrease single_crochet in next 3 sts* 6 times 24 round 12 *decrease single_crochet in next 2 sts* 6 times 18 slip_stitch to the first st to join ch1 and single_crochet then fo this will leave a little tail flip on the body of the hen leave a long enough tail to sew up the back fold the piece in half with the tail at one end if you are using safety eyes add them at the other end between rounds 10 and 11 spaced a few stitches apart if you are embroidering eyes on with yarn this step can wait until the body is closed up using the finishing tail sew the back seam closed stuffing with fiber fill as you go to avoid leaving a ridge try sewing through the front loop only or if you prefer not to sew slip_stitch up the back to close the piece before you fo pattern continued adding details hold the piece with the face end in your left hand if right hand dominant if left handed flip these instructions with red join the yarn in the second stitch in from the left work *single_crochet double_crochet* into that stitch then *double_crochet single_crochet* into the last stitch and fo if embroidering eyes with black cut a length and embroider eyes onto the face end of the piece between rounds 10 and 11 a few stitches apart using a yarn needle with orange cut a length and embroider a beak onto the body using a yarn needle this will go into the space between the eyes but may be placed lower if desired secure any remaining knots and hide ends inside the piece optional nest recommended yarn bernat blanket yarn or other weight 6 super bulky yarn ideal for plush toys in a tan or other light color round 1 create a magic_ring and work 12 single_crochet into the ring 12 round 2 2sc in first st single_crochet in next st *2sc in next st single_crochet in next st* repeat * * around 18
